Class ScoutManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • ScoutManager

  • public class ScoutManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the main program for the Scout Manager project and creates the home screen which is first encountered by the user when application is started
    Author:
    Matthew Brookes

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ScoutManager(javax.swing.JFrame frame)
      This constructor will be called when the home button is pressed at any stage during the system.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.sql.Connection connectToDB()
      Attempts to connect to the database otherwise creates a database.
      private static void drawScreen(javax.swing.JFrame frame)
      This method draws the header and body of the home screen on the frame which is passed
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      Main routine of program which establishes a database if one does not already exist and creates the Scouts and Badges tables if they do not exist.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • ScoutManager

        ScoutManager(javax.swing.JFrame frame)
        This constructor will be called when the home button is pressed at any stage during the system. It will redraw the home screen on the existing frame.
        Parameters:
        frame - The current window when home screen pressed

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main routine of program which establishes a database if one does not already exist and creates the Scouts and Badges tables if they do not exist. Then draws the home screen which the user sees when the program is started.
        Parameters:
        args -

      • connectToDB

        public static java.sql.Connection connectToDB()
        Attempts to connect to the database otherwise creates a database. If encounters a problem then quits system
        Returns:
        Connection The SQLite connection to the database

      • drawScreen

        private static void drawScreen(javax.swing.JFrame frame)
        This method draws the header and body of the home screen on the frame which is passed
        Parameters:
        frame - The current window
